results.title: Early Russian cinema. Vol 7: Evgenii Bauer
results.creator_credit: Evegnii Bauer and A Khanzhonov and Co
results.brief_description: Three short silent films by Soviet director Evegnii Bauer that explore themes of class, sexual politics, doomed love, grief and sanity. “A child of the big city” Mary, a seamstress with a meagre existence who dreams of a grander life of luxury and wealth, meets Victor, a well-do-do young man, who spurns his pretentious peers. Beguiled by the luxuries that pepper Victor’s world, Mary becomes flirtatious and develops a taste for decadent habits. Financially ruined and personally demoralised, Victor despairs at Mary’s transformation. This mournful, melancholy melodrama, and morality play, examines the notions of class and corrupting influence of money on character. “The 1102nd ruse” An elderly husband believes himself inured to the skilful wiles of women, to the frustration of his scheming wife. But she is determined to hoodwink him by inventing a cunning ruse unfamiliar to him. A slight comedy of manners that comments on the power of sexuality whilst gently mocking the sanctity of marriage. “Daydreams” A man, mourning the death of his wife, is soon romancing an actress who shares a likeness with his deceased beloved. As his obsession grows, he fears insanity and is beset by ghostly apparitions. All feature musical score, Russian intertitles and English subtitles.

results.title: Drunken boat = Bateau ivre
results.creator_credit: Alfred Chaumel, Henri Beauvais and Franfilmdis
results.brief_description: After the poems of J. Arthur Rimbaud and the symphony “Bateau Ivre” by Robert Bergmann. Prelude for two voices Simon Gantillon and the voice of Rimbaud is Jean-Luis Barrault. In French with no English subtitles.

results.title: Drivers I have known and hated
results.brief_description: Looks at some of the most aggravating and dangerous drivers on the roads today and identifies many frustrating and hazardous situations caused by drivers with poor attitudes. Inspires viewers to examine their own driving habits.

results.title: Drive smart: improve your driving skills before you take the test (PC)
results.brief_description: Drive smart is an interactive package designed to assist learner drivers in improving driver education, safety and skills, before taking the all important driver’s licence test. Each module will help you become familiar with the necessary responses and actions required when driving, including scanning and hazard perception and making judgements on a number of driving scenarios and quizzes. It is emphasised that this is a training supplement and is not designed to replace supervised driving practice. “Drive smart” was developed with the assistance of Monash University Accident Research Centre over a period of three years using state of the art driving simulators. For more information visit www.drivesmart.vic.gov.au.

results.title: Drinking-driving. Edited version
results.creator_credit: Warren J Mills, Ansvar Insurance and Christopher Productions
results.brief_description: An experiment conducted by the University of New South Wales shows that the intake of alcohol has a detrimental effect on the driving performance of both the ordinary motorist and the skilled racing driver. Shows both drivers tackling a course before drinking, and then at blood-alcohol levels of .05 and .08.

results.title: Down to earth
results.creator_credit: Paul Klee, Gilbert Lauzun and A United Nations Productions
results.brief_description: Since the space age began, the U.N. has been concerned with using “outer space” technology for the benefit of the developing, as well as the advanced nations. As examples of peaceful applications of the new technology, the film shows how orbiting satellites bring instructional television to India, survey a rain forest and search the Altiplano for minerals in Bolivia and monitor a typhoon in the Phillippines.

results.title: Doppler principles (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Air Training Command and Dept of the Air Force
results.brief_description: Uses animation to present the phenomenon of the Doppler effect. Explains the effects on a transmitted wave when it encounters a moving object or when the transmitter itself is moving. Also explains the Doppler effect when the target is moving at various angles to the transmitter.

results.title: Don't send your daughter
results.creator_credit: Robin Roger Cook and Audio-Visual Aids, University of Melbourne
results.brief_description: Produced for the Students Representative Council, University of Melbourne, this film summarises the first year of life at the University. It shows new students at the “freshers” camp at Anglesea; the main sections of the University; view of the library and instructions how to use it; scenes at the Cabaret Ball; an Engineering School lecture; sports activities; graduating ceremony; exams.

results.title: Don't give up on me
results.brief_description: A look at the child abuse problem from the desperate parents’ point of view. Barbara, a mother of two small children, is accused of abusive behaviour and in danger of having her baby taken from her by the courts. We see Barbara’s State-assigned case worker, struggling to help the distraught mother come to grips with her problem. An adapted case history which uses scenes from an actual counselling workshop for child abuse parents.
